ch.ecma.csta.media

Interface MediaServices

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    ChanneledMediaServices

    public interface MediaServices
    Enables access to the media stream of a call through attachment and detachment of media services to the call.
    Version:
    $Revision: 1.4 $
    Author:
    AVAYA, Inc.
    See Also:
    "ECMA-269, sections 19.1 Media Attachment Services and 6.8.7 Media Stream Access."

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Deprecated Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addMediaListener(DeviceID device, MediaListener listener)
      Deprecated. 
      Use MonitoringServices.addMediaDeviceListener instead.
      AttachMediaServiceResponse attachMediaService(AttachMediaService request)
      Not supported.
      Attaches an existing call to a media service instance for the purpose of transmitting media stream data to the call or receiving media stream data from the call.
      DetachMediaServiceResponse detachMediaService(DetachMediaService request)
      Not supported.
      void removeMediaListener(DeviceID device, MediaListener listener)
      Deprecated. 
      Use MonitoringServices.removeMediaListener instead.

    • Method Detail

      • attachMediaService

        AttachMediaServiceResponse attachMediaService(AttachMediaService request)
                                       throws CstaException
        Not supported.
        Attaches an existing call to a media service instance for the purpose of transmitting media stream data to the call or receiving media stream data from the call. See the AttachMediaService request for more information.

        Parameters:
        request - an AttachMediaService service request
        Returns:
        an attach media service response message
        Throws:
        CstaException - for any future exceptions.

      • detachMediaService

        DetachMediaServiceResponse detachMediaService(DetachMediaService request)
                                       throws CstaException
        Not supported.
        Detaches a previously attached media service instance from a call. This request releases a previously established association (binding) between a connection and a media service. If a media access device was added to the call when the media service instance was attached and that media access device is no longer needed, then the media access device is removed (or more specific, cleared) from the call. See the DetachMediaService request for more information.

        Parameters:
        request - a DetachMediaService service request
        Returns:
        a detach media service response message
        Throws:
        CstaException - for any future exceptions.

      • addMediaListener

        void addMediaListener(DeviceID device,
                      MediaListener listener)
               throws CstaException
        Deprecated. Use MonitoringServices.addMediaDeviceListener instead.
        Not supported.
        Adds a listener to monitor the specified device for attachment and detachment of media services to the call.

        Java listeners are used to implement the CSTA concept called monitoring.

        When an event occurs, the corresponding listener callback is called. A default callback is provided by MediaAdapter for each possible event. The default callbacks do nothing. If you want to act upon events, you can customize the events' callbacks for your application in either of the following ways:

        • Provide an implementation of every callback method in the MediaListener interface with a class that implements MediaListener.
        • Provide an implementation of a subset of callback methods with a class that extends MediaAdapter.

        If multiple listeners are added, then each listener will be notified of events; the corresponding callback will be called on each listener that has been added.

        Parameters:
        device - the device to which the MediaListener is applied.
        listener - the listener being applied to the device. The listener may be an implementation of the MediaListener interface or an extension of MediaAdapter. If the specified listener is null, no exception is thrown and no action is performed.
        Throws:
        CstaException - for any future exceptions.

      • removeMediaListener

        void removeMediaListener(DeviceID device,
                         MediaListener listener)
                  throws CstaException
        Deprecated. Use MonitoringServices.removeMediaListener instead.
        Not supported.
        Removes a previously specified media listener. It is possible for a callback to be issued on a listener after it has been removed. If no listeners have been added, then nothing happens when an event occurs.

        If the specified listener is not one that was previously added, then no exception is thrown and no function is performed. Also, if the specified listener is null, no exception is thrown and no action is performed.

        Parameters:
        device - the device whose MediaListener is to be removed
        listener - the listener being removed from the device.
        Throws:
        CstaException - for any future exceptions.
